sentences.en: A new outbreak of smallpox occurred in 1928.
After the outbreak of fighting, all foreign journalists were expelled.
sentences.cn: 战斗开始后, 所有的外国记者都被驱逐出境.

sentences.en: At the outbreak of the war he lived in London.
sentences.cn: 战争爆发时他住在伦敦.

sentences.en: Conditions were ripe for an outbreak of cholera.
Discontent among the ship's crew finally led to the outbreak of mutiny.
sentences.cn: 船员的不满情绪最终酿成了暴乱。

sentences.en: Experts fear that there will be new outbreak of the disease.
sentences.cn: 专家们担心这种疾病会再度流行.

sentences.en: In Peru, a cholera outbreak continues to spread.
sentences.cn: 霍乱在秘鲁各地相继爆发。

sentences.en: The ambassador did his utmost to prevent the outbreak of hostilities.
sentences.cn: 这位大使竭尽全力防止战事的爆发.

sentences.en: The cholera outbreak has been contained.
sentences.cn: 霍乱的发生已被控制住了.

sentences.en: the outbreak of a flu epidemic
There appears to be another outbreak of sickness among seals in the North Sea.
sentences.cn: 看来北海的海豹又要爆发另一场疾病了。

sentences.en: This evidence supports their contention that the outbreak of violence was prearranged.
sentences.cn: 这一证据证实了他们的观点，即此次突发暴力事件是有预谋的。

trans.tran_cn: （战争，怒气等的）爆发，突然发生
trans.tran_en: the sudden start of sth unpleasant, especially violence or a disease
